channel.title: Slow Sand Filter on Sustainable Community Development Hub
channel.description: Recent content in Slow Sand Filter on Sustainable Community Development Hub

item.title: Slow Sand Filtration
item.description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fBKlXDx6txo Flow rate and operation of slow sand filter explained along with gradiation of fine sand and gravel below the source water. Flow rates of 0.015-0.15 gpm/ ft^2 expected for typical performance with entry water of < 10 NTU.. Two day period of establishing Schmutzdecke Algal layer on the surface of the slow sand filter is explained and how that period sends water passing though back to the waste water well rather than stored in the clearwell.

item.title: rainwater harvesting combined with slow sand filter
item.description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BaCOlRlw3K4 edvac1 dave Published on Feb 17, 2010 Capture the rain! (Now legal in Washington state). A quick look at roof water harvesting using a slow sand filter combined with a diverter. This is an overview of the procedure and a demonstration of a working system. An instructional video on how to build a system can be found here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S-_RDB… As of September 18, 2016 this filter is still running and producing clean water.
